channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: Republican Rep. Nancy Mace discusses Trump's response to immigration protests
item.description: NPR speaks with Republican Rep. Nancy Mace of South Carolina about her bill to defund "lawless cities" and about President Trump's deployment of troops following protests against immigration raids.

item.title: Flight carrying 242 people bound for London has crashed in Ahmedabad, India
item.description: An Air India flight with 242 passengers and crew that was bound for London crashed in India's northwestern city of Ahmedabad shortly after departure.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: What polls says about Trump immigration policies, Trump administration plans repeal of power plant pollution limits, House GOP considers plan forcing schools to reimburse part of unpaid student loans.

item.title: Brian Wilson biographer discusses the legacy of the genius behind The Beach Boys
item.description: Brian Wilson, the troubled genius behind The Beach Boys, has died at age 82. NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with biographer Peter Ames Carlin about Wilson's legacy.

item.title: Why many people are financially anxious despite being richer than earlier generations
item.description: Young people in the U.S. are richer than previous generations were at their age. Yet many in Gen Z are financially anxious. NPR's The Indicator asks neuroscientists about "money dysmorphia."

item.title: EU, Britain and Spain reach border deal on Gibraltar
item.description: Gibraltar has been the focus of territorial disputes for centuries. But the European Union, Spain and Britain have announced a deal to resolve border issues after Brexit.

item.title: Hear what some supporters of President Trump think about his immigration policies
item.description: How do Trump supporters feel about his immigration policies, as protests spring up across the country and after the administration deployed troops to Los Angeles?

item.title: A look at public opinion polling on Trump's immigration policies and how it's changed
item.description: NPR takes a look at where President Trump stands when it comes to public opinion polling on immigration and how that has shifted over time.

item.title: Groups that resettle refugees say more than 125,000 in limbo despite judge's order
item.description: Three months after a federal judge ordered the Trump administration to restart the refugee admissions program it froze, groups that resettle refugees say more than 125,000 people are stuck in limbo.

item.title: Former Secretary of State John Kerry discusses the UN Ocean Conference
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with John Kerry, former secretary of state and Biden-era climate envoy, about the 2025 UN Ocean Conference in Nice, France.
